Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, great location.”
Reviews.Author: olgabs
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son and I stayed here on a quick trip during spring training. We liked the location on a golf course and the easy access to Salt River Fields, Scottsdale, the Zoo and the Botanical Gardens. We had a room on the 5th floor with a view of the golf course and the mountains. It's not as fancy as many of the luxury resorts in the area but it was certainly nice enough and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. The suite was clean, the breakfast & happy hour were great as always. The staff was kind enough to let us check in at 11:00 am, too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time after Time”
Reviews.Author: TP47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal place for business or pleasure. The rooms are an excellent size and really well appointed with a kitchen area and great bathroom. There is a desk if you need to do some work and a balcony if you have more time on your hands. Breakfast is a great experience with made to order eggs and pancakes and a great selection of other juices pastries and fruit. We have our a company meetings here for a couple of days at a time and the desk and back room staff could not have been more helpful in making our life easier. You are better bringing your own projector and flip charts etc as they are not cheap. Early evenings are made very pleasant with complimentary drinks from 5.30 - 7.00. If you are staying for more than a few nights the menu id a little limited so its worth stepping out for a change there are plenty of places close by. The outside pool and patio are is really nice and evenings are made warmer with fire pits being lit.The hotel is set with a golf course in a quiet part of town. All in all a really good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: candygirl04
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room over a month ahead of schedule, fully paid for. When we got to the hotel a couple hours early, we had been driving all night, were exhausted, & badly in need of showers. The girls at the front desk were incredibly snooty & in no way accommodating. They told us there was no possible way we could check in then, but that if we came back around noon, there would probably be something available, since that was check out time. Turns out we were lied to about when we could check in. We came back at 12:45pm & there was absolutely NOTHING available still. Once again, the girls seemed put-out by us asking for our room. They told us we could wait at the bar for a little while & they would come & get us when a room was available, making it sound as though it would be very soon. We still needed to shower at this point. FINALLY, at 1:30pm, they let us go up to our room. When we got there, it was not the room we had reserved. It was a handicapped room. We figured that was not so bad, since it meant a bigger shower & balcony. However, looking inside the shower, the nozzle was ZIP-TIED to the bar, making it impossible to move up & down or remove at all. Also, the room was clearly not built level because without a lip on the shower, the water flowed out of the shower & spread all across the floor of the bathroom, making it slippery & treacherous. & they gave us no rubber mats or anything of the like for the bathroom floor. We looked in the mini-fridge & there was no mini bar at all. Not that we planned on using it, because they are always ridiculously expensive, but when we reserved the room, it said there would be one. & when my reservation tells me I will have something, I expect it to be there. When we got into bed that night, the sheets were scratchy & uncomfortable. the bottom of the COMFORTER was softer than the sheets, so we ended up stripping the sheet off & sleeping with just the comforter on the bed. The buffet in the morning was an absolute disaster. The room they used was way too small for the massive amount of people who attended. There was absolutely no organization in terms of lines or hotel staff present to indicate where to go or in what order. So people were shoving in front of us & being very rude. It made breakfast very unenjoyable for us. When we called the management to tell them all of this, they offered us no additional amenities or any apologies. They simply said, "Thank you for informing us of the situation." We have never stayed at a hotel of this stature, coming so highly recommended, & had such horrible service in all of our travels. We will NOT be returning to this facility!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property with lousy front desk service”
Reviews.Author: robcau
Reviews.Content: I'll get the negative out of the way first. We reserved and pre-paid for a high floor golf course/pool view room. This hotel has 6 floors. When we checked in at 3p, not only were there no high floor rooms in our room type available, there were no rooms ready at all in our room type. We we're told the 3rd floor was the best they can do or we can have a parking lot view higher up. No apology....just very matter of fact take it or leave it attitude. I reminded them of my pre-paid rate that I booked on their website and was told that this sometimes happens....again no attempt to apologize. If anything, he seemed bothered I was asking at all. We chose the 3rd floor room as we really wanted the golf course/pool view. We then were told that they were still cleaning our room and to take a seat in the lobby for about 20 min. We were also told we would be advised right away once the room was ready. Thirty minutes later, I went back to see the status of the room. He said that it's been ready for a while and gave me the key with no apology for having us just sit there. I then asked him when a higher floor room would be available. He said that tommorrow, some higher floor rooms would open up and to speak to the front desk in the morning. In the meantime our 3rd floor room balcony overlooked an overhang that goes out to the pool. The top of the overhang was littered with trash. The next morning, I went back to the front desk and spoke to a manager, who advised me that the guy the night before never should have told us there were higher floor rooms available the next day as this was not true. He said we'd have to wait until tomorrow. We were only there 4 nights, and 2 of them were in a room type we didn't want and hadn't pre-paid for. Again, the manager was very apathetic and acted like I was irritating him. Furthermor, there was no offer made to refund the rate difference or compensate us in any way. Half way through the trip, they did indeed find us a higher floor room (6th floor) and moved our stuff for us (after we had packed it all up). That was greatly appreciated and made all the difference in the world! The hotel itself is very nice! The suites were clean and comfortable with excellent housekeeping services. The breakfast was ample and pretty good....especially the made to order omlettes. The evening manager reception was great. It's basically an open bar from 5:30p - 7:30p. As other people have said, the snacks are nothing to write home about, but certainly fine. The pool and hot tub area was nice, but the pool itself is not well taken care of. There was a brown film around the inside edge of the pool from the waterline up. It's obviously not cleaned regularly and kind of gross. The views from this side of the property are wonderful. The golf course driving range is literally 50 feet from the pool deck. Beyond that are beautiful hills and mountains to enjoy all day long. The hotel is very close to the Paradise Valley Mall and there a lot of nearby restaurants. Would we stay here again? You bet we would, but we'd go in knowing not to expect much from the front desk folks and that we may or may not get the room we reserved. I see that a manager writes responses to these reviews. I certainly hope he/she is noticing the trend in most of these reviews......nice hotel....lousy front desk service. Some people may not be so forgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bridgeable2
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Scottsdale (tho really Paradise Valley) is centrally located and offers a lot for the money. Great 2 hour cocktails..not just beer & wine but anything you want. Cold snacks, salsa, chips, popcorn (not fresh, but bagged) and snack mix were served. Not the best snacks but adequate. The breakfast was fantastic-cooked to order omelets or poached eggs too, plus sausages, bacon, potatoes, cold cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit. Wonderful! There is a golf course right next to the hotel..in fact you can walk over to the pro shop. You get a slight discount if staying at the hotel. We had a beautiful room but it overlooked the parking lot..ASK to look over the golf course. Our hotel was booked solid as it was spring training in Phoenix. Also, the maid service was not up to par..one day they didn't service our room and when we called at 5pm everyone had gone home for the day. They sent someone up for "light" housekeeping..but they didn't even make the bed! NEVER have I had a hotel bed not made everyday. When we called, they took care of it. Overall I would say the maid service was a big drawback as we are gone all day and like to come back to a clean room!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good location & good value”
Reviews.Author: GkMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights in February around President's Weekend. All in all we liked the hotel. I agree with other reviews that the front desk reception is not the strongest. Although the bellman was quite helpful and friendly. We paid for an upgraded room facing the golf course and were told none was available. Upon further searching, the front desk clerk was able to find a room for us. It faced the clubhouse, but that wasn't a problem, although you can hear the loudspeaker and there was a wedding on Saturday evening. The strong positives for us: comfortable suite hotel in a good location for touring around Phoenix and Scottsdale with full made to order breakfast. And, the hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport. The room was fine; very clean and the bed was comfortable. The view of the golf course is lovely. We didn't have time to hang out on the property so I can't comment on the pool, etc. but the common areas were clean and comfortable. Used the business center to print out boarding passes; the center was clean, had office supplies and the printers worked well. Breakfast was GREAT; made to order eggs and efficiently done. The cooks were so nice and friendly. The dining room has nice views of the golf course. Took advantage of the cocktail hour once--bartender's were also friendly and welcoming. Nice choice of liquor and beer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay besides rocky start!”
Reviews.Author: beatle15
Reviews.Content: We were in the area for baseball spring training games during our spring break. Let me start with the great parts of this hotel. The breakfast was excellent. Quick efficient omelet bar. The line moved fast and the service was great. Very nice efficient breakfast staff. We enjoyed breakfast two days out of our 3 day stay. Cooked to order omelets, eggs any style all cooked perfectly. Bacon, Sausage, potatoes, toast, bagels, hot and cold cereal just about anything you might want for breakfast. The rooms are old but clean. The housekeeping staff was excellent and took good care of our requests daily. The rooms definitely need updating. We did have a lovely view of the golf course and pool. Nice warm evenings on the small patio were very nice. Swimming pool is very small but nice. The managers reception was good. The bartenders were awesome and very friendly. We requested a dust free room when we arrived and were told there were none available by a very rude young man. "alan" did not welcome us and did not explain the lay out of the hotel. He did not tell us when breakfast started or when the manager's reception started. He did not even bother to show us the general direction of either event. We did not know where the elevators were and had to hunt around to find them. We asked to be contacted if a dust free room came avaialble and were never called during our 4 day stay. Other than the rude welcome everything else worked out good for us. We will stay again and hopefully bring additional family members with us. The location of the hotel was nice and we were able to get around very easily. Lots of places to eat including our favorite : In and Out Burger across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, okay area”
Reviews.Author: CindeeP
Reviews.Content: I was here from a Sunday through Thursday with a small-ish group for a business meeting. I was given a room overlooking the parking lot and the hotel entrance-- unfortunately, a high-traffic area outside the hotel. Some of the desk staff and concierge staff were a bit less than friendly, seeming bothered when I asked a question. The breakfast staff were very friendly and eager-to-please. I liked the location right next to the golf course and the walking trail and about a 5-10 minute walk from the Paradise Valley mall. I was very irritated to find that Hilton HHonors had deactivated my account and removed all of my points for about the third time (my card reads 'member since 2000')-- after calling, I found out they remove your points if you go 12 months without activity. I used to stay at Hilton properties a bit more frequently, but knowing they have taken away my points repeatedly, I now opt for Marriott hotels or Hyatt whenever possible. I know this does not relate just to this hotel, but it should serve as a caution to those of us who don't travel all the time to choose wisely among the reward programs.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: rennibug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Embassy Suites and I have to say it was fantastic - our room was on the 6th floor overlooking the pool, golf course and mountains in the distance - I did take the suggestion of staying away from the club house since you could hear them calling names early in the morning - the 2 room suite was very spacious - even with the National Soccer team staying there for their spring training the hotel never seemed too crowded or noisy - the morning breakfast buffet had everything you could have wanted - the staff cooking the eggs were so friendly and accommodating - all the staff in the hotel were great - the daily happy hour was good - the only complaint on that was the munchies they had with the drinks - needed more of a variety besides the chips and salsa, goldfish and fruit - I do have a special thank you to the general manager Ila (hope I spelled her name correctly) - she came over to great us during happy hour and I told her they should have magnifying mirrors in the bathroom for us women who need them to apply our makeup - right away she ordered one up for me and it was waiting in my room when I returned - very nice person - the pool and hot tub were perfect - it really felt good to take a dip - we lucked out with the temperature - while we were there it was between 75-80 degrees - the location of the hotel is great - just down the road from Scottsdale Road - you won't be disappointed if you choose this hotel - we will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel during the week”
Reviews.Author: KatNick007
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of other reviews, we selected this hotel. Our stay was Thursday-Monday. I am a Hilton honors Gold member traveling with my husband. I used points for our stay and had reserved a mountain/golfcourse view room. Upon check-in, I was assigned a room overlooking the street and was told there were no other rooms available. I found that hard to believe because the parking lot wasn't too crowded. After much discussion, the front desk clerk finally found another room with the view I had requested. I didn't really expect to be hassled like this. We had just flown across the country and were tired. Anyway, we finally got into our room and all was better. The room was typical 2-room suite. We were in room #6013 and has a great view from both the bedroom and the patio. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nicely redone. The sofa was frayed and sagging and needed to be replaced. As said in a previous review, the furniture in the lobby and throughout the hotel needs to be updated. The hotel was a very nice experience on Thursday and Sunday and the weekend was another story. Several large groups took over the hotel on Saturday. The pool area is very small and they had half of the area. They were wheeling in coolers and carrying in 12 packs of beer and being rather loud. Finally, management came out and told them they can't have their coolers and their own beer. I wish they would've come sooner because it was hard to enjoy a beautiful Saturday afternoon at the pool with all the chaos going on in such a small area. The area is nice around the hotel, not as nice as Scottsdale, but many different choices of restaurants nearby. We enjoyed walking the trails through the neighborhoods. The business center was usually available but the printer needed servicing. We had to ask the front desk to print our boarding passes as you could not read them from the printer in the business center. All and all, enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great all suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: BongoColo
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice here in Nov and were very impressed both times. The rooms are suites as you would expect at an Embassy Suites, but generally much larger and equipped with everything you could want including flat screen TV's in every room. It is a little older and the decor a little worn, but well maintained. The rooms we had included beautiful view balconies that are actually large eunough to sit several people at. There is a beautiful golf course at the hotel. The dining room and lounge were excellent with a complimentary managers cocktail hour, and a great complimentary buffett breakfast with a cooked to order omelet with everything imaginable available. All at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: mh111606
Reviews.Content: We always travel with our 5 year-old son, and therefore prefer staying in hotel rooms that are suites. This hotel's rooms are spacious with a separate bedroom and very comfortable bed, and a living room with sleeper sofa, which makes this the perfect place for families. All rooms have private balconies, and depending on where your room is located, you can have some amazing views of the golf course and surrounding mountains. Enjoy the free cooked-to-order breakfast downstairs while enjoying great golf course and mountain views. There's a restaurant and bar on the first floor, as well as an outdoor pool and spa overlooking the golf course. Service was excellent! I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginny124
Reviews.Content: There wasn't one thing wrong with this hotel. The staff, restaurants, complimentary breakfast, room, view and location were all great. It is situated on a golf course and although I don't golf but my husband does there was plenty to do. Shopping is within walking distance, walking around the property and golf course every day was very pleasant.....just a nice relaxing place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Twinder
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suite proved to be in a very convenient location - close to the AZ 51 freeway and Paradise Valley Mall area [Wal-Mart, In & Out etc.] at Cactus & Tatum. I recently stayed here for 5 nights and found their staff very friendly and helpful. Ada, Tiffany, Daniel, Adam and Evan at the front desk were always ready to assist. The large suite-room was clean and comfortable. The walkway around the golf course was terrific for my early morning treks. Good choice for my stay in the Valley of the Sun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff and far better than other Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: johnydolittle
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 days in Phoenix and 5 at this property and 3 at the ES in North Phoenix and this property is far superior than the North Phoenix location. Rooms were updated and clean. It is a little tricky to find. It is located on Stoen Creek Golf Course. Lauren the bartender was very nice and the superstar was Pat. She was a bartender a few nights and I think her offical role is Restaurant supervisor. She went far above her normal duties to make sure my stay was amazing and helped me cordinate a little get together with friends after a Limo light tour. Alan I think his name was (had a broken wrist) was also a great asset. Everything was great at this hotel and I regret staying at the othe ES. Good location, tons of restaurants close to the hotel, however the food here was pretty darn good. Of course they had the free breakfast and 2 hours of free drinks every night. The only thing I wish they would do for the free drinks is to add bottled beer for Hilton Honor members. I don't drink tap beer and never get to take advantage of this. No Biggie. I asked the chef (female, forgot her name) for an omlette with american cheese and they only had cheddar for the breakfast. However, she went back in the kitchen and found me some. It is the little things that make this place great. I can't say anything bad about thos property, staff was excellent, hotel was clean. All in all a great stay. I will be posting a review of the North Phoenix ES and that is a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Embassy”
Reviews.Author: 89AV8R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Embassy while on a business trip in December 2011. Rooms were good, service great, and location was okay for us. I would come back. The breakfast was better than most Embassy Suites hotels. Also enjoyed the evening reception sitting outside by the fire. The beds were unusually comfortable. Slept great the four nights there. The water int the room took forever to get hot each time I used the sink or shower. Really the only downer. I did like the layout of the room, too. It was a little different floor plan from other Embassy Suites hotels I have stayed at, and it was well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TraveltimeSS
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this place on my business trips. The hotel has a great view of the golf course and is walking distance from a mall, restaurants, gas stations, grocery store, banks, etc. Not a bad hotel at all. You obviously cant beat the breakfast in the AM, but hotel is very clean and we've never had a an issue staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVegasALot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice now and would not hesitate to recommend it. It has an excellent location right on the golf course, with a pool, and a great shopping area across the street. The rooms are clean and comfortable - not to mention spacious. I find Embassy Suites are very reliable and I enjoy my stays at them.

Reviews.Title: “Its and Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: indyfan71
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel @ all however was a little dissapointed with the cleaning in hall ways. Seemed to have left some trash overnight and through day in same spots. Other than that its an Embassy Suites! GREAT Managers reception (allows most anything in bar area, GREAT VALUE)! Breakfast was fantastic. Pool and Hot tub was VERY well needed and I used it... Value for dollar spent / location was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Better than your typical Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: dcslatts
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is more of an upscale resort hotel on a golf course than my standard image of the tired Embassy "atrium" experience. The staff was wonderful and the room is clean and large. Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MartySmith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days here before attending a convention in Phoenix. It was great, from a clean room, to friendly staff, great view, breakfast overlooking the golf course and the manager's reception was a nice touch before dinner. When we went to our high end, very expensive convention hotel downtown, it was a big let down. We were spoiled by the room and service at the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Love the free happy hour”
Reviews.Author: malPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: Nothing spectacular but a solid choice. Nice pool. Great free breakfast and happy hour. Convenient location. All for a very reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: ckone0814
Reviews.Content: Perfectly fine place. Nice and clean, good free breakfast (choose made-to-order "over" eggs instead of scrambled carton eggs on the buffet), nice managers reception w/ free drinks, good views from most rooms, location seemed to be ideal. Staff was excellent except for the miserable female bartender who was griping to the two barflies at the end about the the people enjoying the free drinks who were taking up space at her pay bar (yes, we saw you and you lost a tip). For one sweetie, there were plenty of empty stools and two, the two previous nights the manager's reception WAS at that bar due to weather. How are customers to know? Give your boss the hairy eyeball.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable resort in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: BeauRoch242
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel with its own golf course! The free buffet breakfast is a nice bonus. My wife and I enjoyed our stay there. There are certainly nicer places but for the price it will be hard to beat this place. Plus, there is a free happy hour each night at the bar - free beer, wine and well drinks are a nice way to unwind a bit. The pool was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Extras!”
Reviews.Author: tjocCanada
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel. The rooms were spacious. The great extras such as free breakfast and managers reception were good bonuses. We used the hotel shuttle all three nights to take us to restaurants and a party at a family members home near the hotel. It is free and we tipped the driver.Finding a cab is difficult in this area so this was by far the best benefit- you don't have to worry about having a drink and driving.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: TimCreech
Reviews.Content: This hotel had it all. The rooms were spacious and had a balcony overlooking the pool, palm trees, golf course, and mountains. The bed room was separated by a door. Living area and bedroom each had a flat screen TV. The bath room could be accessed from either the bedroom or the living area. The bathroom was separated into the toilet and shower separated by a door to the sink and counter area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Cody447
Reviews.Content: Arrived 9/29/11 for the Cards vs Giants game. Naturally this was a road trip and not a vacation, lol. This is my second time in approximately 4 years staying at this ES. It is about a 20 minute shuttle ride from the airport. The Stadium was about a 40 minute ride from the ES, by bus. The staff was still courteous, helpful and expedient. The hotel is a bit difficult to navigate but you get the hang of it quick. My buddy and I stay in room 4012, which is an end room. It was clean and kept in good condition. Very roomy, comfortable beds, nice size balcony overlooking the pool, golf course and mountains. The bathroom was directly off the bedroom and laid out in sort of a strange way. You entered from the bedroom into the toilet and tub/shower room (it was poorly lit as well) and then through another door to a room with a sink/vanity/mirror. Then exit through a door into the foyer by the hotel room door. Btw, the shower was very good. The "kitchenette" was to the left and then opened up into the living room area. Bedroom and living room both had TVs. As usual, the ES breakfast was fantastic, as was the Manager's Happy Hour!!!! The pool and whirlpool were clean and towels offered poolside. Didn't get a chance to play golf but other people we were with enjoyed the course. A few other couples rented a SUV and did a day trip to Flagstaff and Sedona. We did a day at Talkingstick casino but I wouldn't recommend going there unless you want to lose your money. Didn't look like anyone was winning in that place! There are plenty of stores near by to pick up whatever snacks and beverages you may need for your room. I definitely recommend this ES.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - will consider coming back”
Reviews.Author: mistyskyblue
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a nice hotel. Our stay was comfortable. The bedroom is not that big, but is decent. The suite takes bigger area and is nice to have. Balcony is decent size. Its location is close to many local shops. Bed could be firmer. There is a safe in the room too. Internet is only free in the lobby. The hotel has daily afternoon snack time at which time many guests gather at their bar to enjoy chips, snacks free. It is more of a golfer hotel as many golfers stay there for their golf course. I will consider it and stay there again if I don't have anything better when it is time.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back .”
Reviews.Author: janieCrawleyUk
Reviews.Content: We come here every year and get a really good rate because we pre-pay.IT is really good value for money,LOcation is great ,with many restaurants nearby, Staff are awesome ,.Cooked to order breakfast usually by Lorena who is a real star,Any thing she can do for. You and she will.I think it's often the staff that make any stay in hotel great and this one has a great team ,.The new manager is striving to make your stay a perfect 10 and if there is a problem she wants to know about it before you leave ,. wE will be back next year for sure .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but NO kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Joy K
Reviews.Content: This was, overall, a really nice hotel with an excellent made-to-order breakfast. However, travelers should be aware that, contrary to the advertising on the Embassy Suites web site, these rooms do NOT have a galley kitchen. When making my hotel selection, I was specifically looking for a room with a kitchenette as I was traveling with a toddler and wanted to be able to prepare some meals in the room. I was very frustrated to find that the "kitchen" was nothing more than a wet bar with a small microwave (inconveniently placed at toddler level so my daughter could press all the buttons) and a mini-fridge. There were no utensils or dishes and no place to sit down and eat a meal. Also, the amenities I ordered ahead of time that were supposed to be in the room prior to my arrival (crib, extra blankets) were not there and I had to contact the front desk several times before they finally arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great located in a very nice part of Scottsdale and right on a golf course. Has some really good golf packages as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on our 3,000+ mile Trip!”
Reviews.Author: lbruna
Reviews.Content: This is 5 star all the way. If u haven't experienced the Embassy Suite hotels then start here. I'm not sure how they do it for the price but they do. We've stayed at the Phoenician before when in Scottsdale but this nite we'd read the reviews on this Embassy Suite & it was in the exact location we wanted to be. Do based upon recommendations we gave it a try knowing we could always move if we had too. We ended up staying there all 3 nites. It's situated on a golf course (ask for a room overlooking that). It was quiet and relaxing. Breakfast is pretty amazing considering it comes free with the room with cooked to order omelets too! There was a business group there having a function, there were families w kids- all blended well. The staff was discreet & helpful. Our room, the public areas, even the laundry room are immaculate. All this for $101.00/nite w our AAA discount. We were so pleased w every detail. Did I mention location? There is a Whole Foods around the corner, a fabulous mall the opposite direction, and a terrific local neighborhood restaurant named Floyds on N.Tatum, also around the corner. All the food is fresh, fresh, fresh- relaxed atmosphere & the price is right. A real find. Go- ENJOY! Thanks Embasssy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Miguel E
Reviews.Content: Hotel and service are great, it's what hotels are suppossed to be: a home away. Breakfast was excellent and so the manager's recepcion. The only complaint is that being a family resort, there are no kid's channels on TV, so they had to watch adult programing at night; we called front desk asking for a DVD player and they didn't have any. Of course they have on-demand kid's programs, but kids want to watch their programs over and over again. Beds were double, maybe a queen would be a better choice. But besides that it was an excellent vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstryker
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this location and I think it is my favorite. Always like Embassy Suites but this one was particularly nice. Very clean, spacious rooms and the view from the balcony was great. There is a golf course and it is near the Paradise Valley mall. The area itself felt very secluded and away from the city which is hard to do in Phoenix. The complimentary breakfast is also a wonderful, especially as it is more than the average continental breakfast with tons of choices and made to order omelets. There is also a managers reception at all Embassy Suites that serves snacks, beer, wine, soda and mixed drinks....all complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service I Have Ever Received”
Reviews.Author: Brian602
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Embassy Suites Phoenix-Scottsdale was amazing. The hotel staff was very friendly and everyone treated me as if I was family. The General Manager personally greeted me in the lobby and she was very friendly. You can tell that her personality is carried throughout the hotel. I was upgraded to a suite that overlooked the golfcourse and the views were some of the best of Phoenix. I could see Camelback mountain from my room. The bartender Juan made the best margaritas at the happy hour. The breakfast cooks were very friendly and even remembered my order after only staying a couple of days. I was able to book a town car to the Airport in the Lobby using ET Limousines and they provided excellent service and it was even cheaper than the taxi when I arrived. This hotel is definitely a great value with the free drinks and breakfast. If you are looking for a great hotel to relax and take in the beautiful views that Paradise Valley has to offer you must stay at the Embassy Suites Phoenix-Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great rooms, great stay”
Reviews.Author: phxaz54
Reviews.Content: Having to move out of our house while some significant repairs were undertaken I was looking for something to "live" in. Perfect hotel. Rooms are suites with a nice living room, kitchen, and bedroom. (Microwave, fridge, coffepot) Price was great and they take AAA discount. Breakfast was both buffet and made to order. Very good. Nice bar area with specials and food every night. Nice pool, great views and balcony. Golf is right next door - walking distance. However, internet is not free. Only in the lobby. Do not get a room near the elevator (even 3 rooms away) or you will hear it all night. Also try not to be above the pool or you'll hear kids having fun past your bedtime. Very kid friendly hotel. We stayed all week and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very plush and relaxing, even in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: opinionette
Reviews.Content: My family and I just left ES Pho/Sco. This was a great place. First, it's off a main highway, so there's no noise from vehicles or trucks. The greenery around is lush and beautiful, even in the middle of the desert. We had 2 rooms, and check-in was a breeze. Everyone was SUPER friendly. I kinda felt like I had a "trip advisor" pin on my lapel, they were so nice. I'm not kidding. At least 8 people asked how I was or if I needed anything within the first hour of going in and exploring. We are not golfers, but my husband is in law enforcement, and the first thing he checks before we stay in a strange city is the crime rate around a certain area. I'm not kidding. Then we go to priceline name your own price and get a steal! we paid $60 for each room on a Wednesday night. The room was comfy and cool. The sheets and pillows were sumptuous! I would say the only negative was the a/c in the elevator was not working, but I heard work going on for that. So I'm sure it's fixed by now. lol. The manager's invitation offered free drinks and snacks. We had a late lunch, so we didn't partake, but others did. It was cool, relaxing, and not rushed. The hotel opened in the back to the nice pool below and the golf course beyond that. Our rooms had terraces facing the pool and golf course. Tree canopies were everywhere, and it was super nice. Of COURSE it's hot in Phoenix in July, but the rooms were AWESOME. We heard no noises all night. Just peace and quiet. The next morning, we ate the complementary breakfast...free...and it was superb. Omlettes on request, and a full array of foods. All was hot and ready. Floor-to-ceiling windows opened to the green lush golf course. We aren't golfers, but we had a lovely time. I'm sure golfers are in heaven here! Suffice it to say, we'll be back here. I need to see Taliesin West (Frank Lloyd Wright's Sonoran desert masterpiece, and it's just down the road from here. This is an awesome place. You Must stay here the next time you pass through.

Reviews.Title: “mostly nice except...”
Reviews.Author: qwestioneverything
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with another stay at this hotel. Basically everything you would expect from an Embassy Suite stay if you've stayed at an ES before. If you love a quality hike; it is very close to Camelback Mtn. and Piestewa Peak. There is one problem and it's fairly major to me. The cable channel lineup is very small and they only offer two national news channels Fox News and Headline News. No CNN; I find this to be very strange. NEVER stayed in a hotel w/o CNN. The owner must be a huge right-winger to only offer Fox. So if this is an issue for you, which it's probably not, then this is a nice spot. Close to restaurants and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: bgandl1
Reviews.Content: The staff is solicitous, the food is amazing (the menu is so plain vanilla that I doubted that the food would be good but they do everything just right). The rooms are clean and enormous. Loved jogging by the golf course and the creek in the early morning. Best hotel ever. Somebody knows how to manage a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: thincinc
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the size of the room. We asked for a quite room, and were given one. Staff was very nice, and friendly too. So was the Manager. The free cocktail hour was a plus. I don't know if this is a daily thing, or not. We don't golf, but would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice pool, ok breakfast ....”
Reviews.Author: mathsfun314
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of Embassy Suites. This one was nicely kept and right on a golf course. But the manager's reception was lacking it was chips and cheese dip AND a weird salty dry mix (EVERY NIGHT). But the bartenders were very nice. Breakfast was great if you love omelets. But if you are stuck with the gooey oatmeal or the rubbery pancakes it was frustrating. The rooms were nice. I love the PURE rooms. The pool was beautiful and we spent a lot of time there.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay and will come back”
Reviews.Author: lupusalpha
Reviews.Content: chose this hotel for an extended weekend on my own just to relax and enjoy some sun; next time I´ll come back earlier in the year, June temperatures are a little bit hot for an Austrian coming from the Alps; nice hotel with friendly staff, spacious rooms (but make sure you spend them little extra money and reserve a "golf course view"); the rooms are nice and clean, nice cosy bed; did not like the "floors" (corridors) which were endless, and in strange earth colours - what makes them look "old" form the beginning; an american breakfast is included and offers all the choices; that makes for a good start of the day and gives additional value to the (in my case) very affordable rates; close to the hotel is a huge mall - that offers plenty of shopping opportunities, once you have finished golfing (or want to escape the heat); a map from the hotel with directions would offer some help and could be helpful; although the hotel is supposed to be in Scottsdale, I felt more in the outskirts/residential area, so if you are not into golfing, you probably need a car to get around and into "old Scottsdale";

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: jamaine1066
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel and would have given an excellent rating except that I agree with the previous reviewer about the ridiculas cost of the wi-fi access which is free at every other place that I have stayed in on this trip. I think that the manager should look again at his reply and try to understand what is being said here, rather than what his view is. The staff were lovely and the prepared while you wait breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: BamaCrazy
Reviews.Content: Nice location...on a golf course. Looks great from the outside, a little dated inside the rooms. Biggest complaint: Internet cost $15 each day. What hotels charge for Internet use? Even roach motels have free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views,Not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: bcflyboy
Reviews.Content: Nice property,not so great rooms.Had room on the top floor overlooking the golf driving range,the room was very dated pull out couch look like something from the 70s.carpet needs replaceing.The staff where all great,would give them a 10 out 10.Pool area is also very nice.Location is good with shopping center across the road. tThis could be a 4 or 5 star property if the rooms where updated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Very impressed.”
Reviews.Author: rmc291
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here last month and were very impressed with everything about this hotel. Great location next to a golf course and within walking distance of a large Mall and several good restaurants. Our suite was large and had a balcony. The breakfasts were even better than previous Embassy Suites we have stayed at and the evening drinks reception was good ( though not as varied as the one in Desert Palms we stayed in a couple of years ago). I would definitely recomment this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PEOPLE!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan02
Reviews.Content: I was in the scottsdale area on business and this was my first time at this location. I picked this location due to the brand, you can never go wrong with a FREE made to order breakfast and drinks in the evening. The staff at this location went out of their way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. Everyone smiled and some even remembered my name! Next time in this area I am booking this hotel. Thank you for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Dolce50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two weeks after our house was flooded due to freeze. Breakfast was very good and so was happy hour but that was about it. The rooms are dated and the front desk personnel was neither very friendly or accommodating. Given what we paid per night for our stay I would give this facility a C rating.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't See The Value At All - A Little Tired Too”
Reviews.Author: wwTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights here. The rooms are indeed large and comfortable. But everything was showing signs of wear. The beds seemed a little firmer than one would expect at a Hilton property. Only one type of pillow was available. The comforters were very well worn with the fabric starting to pill up. Didn't want to think what might be on them so they got to rest on the floor. Only found one spare blanket, which was fine for me since I was traveling alone. Internet service was not free, but I was given a code by a very nice employee. Turns out I think she knew I wouldn't have been happy paying $14.95 a day. My room was at the end of the hall and the signal was very weak. My iPhone could not use the wi-fi at all and my laptop was only able to display simple web pages due to the lack of signal. Forget streaming a movie here. I couldn't find a place to plug in a network cable. The TV's are as bad as some have said. Only about 17 channels. Not even CNN. The flat screen TV's are some off brand I have never heard of. The picture is fuzzy on all channels. There is no HD or even digital channels. The pool was very nice and they had excellent bar and food service. The free cocktails and snacks between 5:00 and 7:00 were a nice touch too. Although the line was about 15 minutes for the bar at some points. Other times there was no issue. As previous reviewers mentioned, the free breakfast scrambled eggs were made from a powdered mix and the bacon was that ultra cheap really thin stuff you get a some fast food places. They did have a nice selection of cereals, fruit and yogurt. The staff were clearly well trained, friendly and helpful. They were able to accommodate requests in their own words and did not seem like they were reading a script. One other interesting note: They run a limo company out of the lobby. When I asked for a taxi, I got the impression they were the only option. They quote a flat rate to take you to and from your destination in a Town Car or similar. The staff were exceptional. Just found it strange you weren't given a choice. Overall, the place was OK. I don't think I'd stay there again since at over $200 a night, I can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful nice helpful people and gorgeous view!”
Reviews.Author: Krissyindiana
Reviews.Content: I think that hte people here were just amazing!! We wad an exceptional et taxi service thanks to Jeffrey!!! He was kind and helpful and we appreciated him!! Everyone was so friendly, the rooms were so clean the beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “The Suites were Sweet”
Reviews.Author: GOmaha
Reviews.Content: In preparation for this years' snow-escape trip to Scottsdale, we decided to try the Embassy Suites. We were pleased with the location and its easy access to Scottsdale Road (north or south). We also found the route to the Barrett-Jackson Auto Auction was less complicated than other parts of town we had stayed at in the past 10 years. The free breakfast and manager's happy hour helped keep our meal and beverage costs down a bit and the hotel is next to a great looking golf course and plenty of shopping. The nights were quiet, the rooms were large and the beds were just firm enought for a greats' night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dgadwa
Reviews.Content: I stayed such a long time ago that I won't write a detailed review. However I wanted to post my pictures and a couple comments. I traveled on a business trip in March 08. I was there for an in the hotel conference so I didn't ravel outside the hotel too much. The hotel sits along a golf course so the pool view although small, was not too bad. I have stayed at many hotels in the Embassy Chain and this one is better than most. Rooms were nice, clean, and updated. The complimentary hot breakfast with omelet bar is always good and the evening reception with free drinks is great, especially in AZ where the reception is out on the patio... even in March! I was in Rm 6031 which was on the parking lot side, so the view was.... not so good. The Fitness Center was adequate, treadmills and decent weights. There was a free shuttle to the 5 mi radius. Front desk and all employees were very friendly and helpful - always nice when a single lady is travelling alone! I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: UCONN_Fan
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Phoenix-Scottsdale is a very nice place to stay and a better than average Embassy Suites. The hotel sits adjacent to a golf course in a nice area. However it’s nowhere near the restaurants and major malls of Scottsdale. Here’s the deal: Positives: • Large parking lot – with free parking for the hotel • Service was very good. Check-in was quick and easy and the clerk was friendly and helpful. Bartenders, cooks, and maids were pleasant and accommodating. • Great breakfast with excellent hot omelets and eggs, wide selection of breads and muffins, fruit, etc. Again above average for an Embassy Suites. • Evening reception was very good as well. Name brand beer, decent liquor and wine. A step up from the well junk booze served at some Embassy Suites. Snacks were somewhat limited with nachos and hot cheese each night and one hot item (quiche one night and skins another) which was ok but nothing special. • The golf course offered excellent discounts for hotel guests and the course was in excellent shape. Slight Negatives: • Rooms were clean and spacious but a little dated. The couch and the carpeting could use a refresh. It was worth it to upgrade to a golf course view. • They still charge for internet access which is ridiculous in this day and age. • The location was convenient to the highway (51) but not really Scottsdale as the name would imply. Overall: The value here can’t be beat. Large rooms, good hot breakfast, good reception at night and deals on golf. If you want to have your home base in a decent location at a decent price you can’t go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “average--good pool, poor breakfast, horrible tv's, nice bed”
Reviews.Author: sue32846
Reviews.Content: We stay at embassy suites often with our children and this place needs some updating. The pool is nice wth a large hot tub and a pleasant golf course view. The rooms are typical with above average king bed. Beware that this hotel is 20 minutes from downtown Scottsdale. The TV cable is from the 1970's. Only 10-12 channels with no HD. No children channels (Nick, Disney) worked. Breakfast was much poorer than most Embassy Suites (powdered tasting eggs, no waffles or french toast, and rock hard pancakes). The staff was friendly, but did not seem prepared for the number of guests. I would stay here only one night on business, but would not recommend to families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: marbo05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We upgraded our room to the golf course view which was lovely. The rooms were clean and spacious, and bed comfy, although the couch had some worn places and footstool was marked. It was a good location, and close to shops and restaurants. The complimentary breakfast was great - super custom- made omelets a bonus, and the evening reception (although we only went once) was a nice touch. The front staff were helpful and willingly ran off computer printouts of driving instuctions we requested. The pool was clean, and a decent size. It was very busy on one day of our stay (business conference), but found our room very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to like it, but.....”
Reviews.Author: linwhs66
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past, so we were expecting a pleasant stay. First, the positives. The view of the golf course and mountains was gorgeous. The room was a good size and clean. The bed was good. Now the negatives. Although we requested a quiet room, we had outdoor weddings right below our room on both Saturday and Sunday nights with DJs and lots of noise. Apparentally this is somewhat common in October and November. The hotel was full and there were not enough tables at breakfast and they were out of coffee, etc. We didn't go to the free cocktails, again due to long lines and lack of seating. I don't think we will stay here again and will look elsewhere in a market full of alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Teenagers loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Simba-Mark
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and it continues to provide great value for money. The quality of the food at breakfast is good and the manager's reception in the eveing is a nice way to end a hot, busy day. My sons enjoyed the pool and the adjacent driving range where they could purchase 100 golf balls for under twelve dollars with clubs included. The staff were all very pleasant and always keen to help. The only drawback was the wifi connection was variable and we had to frequently reconnect. Having said that we will definately return for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: DKKT
Reviews.Content: Pros: big rooms, golf course on-site, full restaurant, stores/shopping nearby, nice fitness center, great value/price. Cons: additional high-speed internet fee - even for Hilton Honors members ($14.95 per day) unless you take your laptop to front desk area, may choose a different hotel next time based only on location. Overall, this is what you would expect from Embassy Suites. It fits the needs of families and is safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dsmiley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business/leisure trip in April 2010. The hotel was very nice - one of the nicer Embassy Suites I have seen and, let's face it, you can't beat the free, made-to-order breakfasts and the evening reception each night. The hotel is located on a golf course and has a great view of the mountains and the course. There is an awesome walking/running trail right outside the back of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and our room was extremely clean. The location is just perfect as well. This hotel is very close to the Paradise Valley Mall - you could actually walk there if you wanted to and is close to Target, many restaurants, etc. The neighborhood is also very good - it is Scottsdale, so no worries there. Can't really think of anything negative to say -- the only thing I would make sure to do is request a golf course or mountain view so you can wake up to the beautiful scenery every morning that is AZ.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ClashJam
Reviews.Content: Expectations were low when I paid $59 in advance for an Embassy Suites. I pictured an older and weathered ES, but upon arrival was pleasantly surprised. This is a huge modern hotel situated on a golf course and the rate must have been related to being "off season". The room was not the standard ES type room, but reminded me of a newer Homewood Suites. Since it was over 100 degrees, the AC worked perfectly. Room was clean and spacious, plus a great view of the golf course. Breakfast was superb as well What I don't understand is why there were two 42" flat screen TV's in the room, yet no HD programming available. Looks like the ES needs to step up and purchase an HD package from its cable provider. Also, even though Scottsdale is in the hotel’s name, this ISNT Scottsdale. It was about a 10 minute drive to get to the heart of Scottsdale. But, for $59, that was ok.

Reviews.Title: “get a room - not by the elevator”
Reviews.Author: CVCVws
Reviews.Content: I got this room for a deal at $59 a night. Problem is they stuck us by the elevator - room 3002 to be exact. So right now I am hearing the sound of the elevator door opening and closing with a loud bang about every 3 minutes. In short - tell them you do not want a room anywhere near the elevator! Other than that if you get the room on priceline or hotwire you can stay for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with golf course”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeingtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a conference. We chose this hotel because the conference was located here and we did not want to rent a car and drive each day to the conference. However, if you choose to rent a car, parking is free. The hotel is located a 20 minute drive north of Sky Harbor Phoenix airport. Taxis run about $35 one way. You can also use the Desert Coach service, which is a $40 flat rate one way. Super Shuttle is another option for $19 one way, but it's a shared service and you might end up going to other hotels first before reaching your destination (your hotel or the airport), which might mean that transportation time will be longer than 20 minutes. The hotel recommends Desert Coach service because they are the most reliable, according to the hotel. The front desk will call Desert Coach to arrange transportation for you, but if you want to take a taxi or the Super Shuttle, the front desk will give you phone numbers for you to call. Two of the front desk members said that taxis might not arrive on time and be reliable, but I called the taxi myself the night before and the taxi was there, right on time. The hotel is located in Paradise Valley, and I do not know Phoenix well, but this area seems nice. Paradise Valley Parkway is a loop, and in the center is an indoor mall, as well as a Target and REI. It is easy to walk to Paradise Valley Mall, and it took us about 15 minutes to walk to some of the restaurants on the outskirts of the mall, which is great because we did not have a a car. The hotel lobby is clean and modern with a large lounge area. Check-in and check-out was efficient. I noticed 2 elevators, but since my room was on the second floor, I chose to take the stairs every day except for moving luggage. The stairs are located at the end of the hallways, and sometimes, they will lock you out. Someone had left a towel stuffed in the doorway to prevent that from happening. Our room overlooked the front entrance of the hotel. The hotel is located in a residential area that is quiet, so there are not clubs or bars or restaurants unless you walk towards the main road. The hotel has its own golf course that is shared with condominiums that also overlook the golf course. The view is fabulous from the lobby because you walk into the pool area and then you seen the golf course that is green with a beautiful backdrop of mountains. The pool is nice, not designed for lap swimming, but fun for families. The deepest section is 5 feet. There is also a hot tub. Towels are not provided. Every night from 5:30pm to 7:30pm, there is a manager's reception where they serve free drinks by the outdoor pool and snacks by the indoor lounge area. There are numerous flat screen TVs, so sports fans will be quite happy here. Embassy suites is known for their breakfasts, especially their made to order omelets, and they are great. There is also a hot food section with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, and oatmeal. There is also fresh fruit and yogurt as well as pastries and English muffins and bagels. There is also milk, juice, tea, coffee, and soda. The chef who made my omelet every morning is so pleasant and she remembered me because I ordered the same thing every day. There is usually someone greeting you at the entrance of the restaurant where breakfast is served. They will ask for your room key and then cheerfully say, "Enjoy your breakfast." Our room was nice and modern and spacious for 2 people. As per the usual Embassy Suites room, we had a sitting area with a couch, chair, and desk. We had 2 TVs, one for the "living room" and the other for the bedroom. There is also a desk, as well as a fridge, which is great for storing drinks. There is also a coffee maker, and they provide you with a bottle of water, but according to the tag around the bottle of water, it costs $4.95. It was also nice to have 2 closets, which allowed plenty of space for 2 girls. The interesting thing about the desk is that the socket doesn't provide electricity to charge your phone or other electronic equipment, so make sure you check that when charging electronics. The beds were comfortable. You can hear hallway noise sometimes, but fortunately that didn't bother us too much. Our room was by the staircase, which made it easy for us to go to and from the lobby as long as the towel was stuffed in the door. The bathroom was standard, slightly small, and the bathtub looked a little rusty. Water pressure was fine, but the tub wouldn't drain as quickly with the shower on, so you would be standing in a little bit of water while showering. The good thing is that the sink had a lot of counter space and is not in the same place as the shower, so that one person could be showering while the other was brushing teeth. There is a business center with 3 computers and a printer. The computer is a little bit slow, but there are direct links to airlines to you can check in and print out your boarding passes easily. There is also a small exercise room with about 3 treadmills and 1 elliptical machine. Each has its own Cardio Theater, which is great. You have to bring your own headphones. There are also a limited number of weights. Most people, though, chose to go running outside, swim, or play golf because the weather was quite nice this time of year. Overall, this was a good place to stay for the travelers who are here for a conference and have limited time to explore Phoenix because they have to be at the conference. The golf course and swimming pool are located behind the hotel. The hotel is quiet and in a residential area of Paradise Village. It is a 15 minute walk to some of the nearby restaurants. If you stay here and wish to go other places, you will either have to take a taxi or drive a car. Overall, this was a great conference hotel with a good view of a golf course and mountains in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights over the Christmas Holidays. The best parts of this hotel are the breakfast and the complimentary drinks at night. I should also mention the kids liked the pool because it was warm. However if hot water is important to you when taking a shower or having your room cleaned well maybe you should stay elsewhere. Every morning we had to waste water (desert) by running the hot water (4-5 minutes) so it would warm up so you could get into the shower. My expectations for a shower is that when you turn the temp to the highest setting it should be too warm so you have to adjust it down a little. However not in this hotel as you cranked it to the hottest setting and hoped it might get up to a warm level. Also one day our room was not cleaned...we called down to the front desk at 5pm to let them know and then we went out for dinner. When we came back around 10pm the room was still not clean. Would I recommend this hotel.......No.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: slkw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites over Christmas vacation. The rooms are some of the largest we have been in and the cooked to order breakfast was outstanding. When our daughters came down with stomach flu in the middle of the night and we had a housekeeping issue the night manager switched us to a clean room immediately. The pool which is on the golf course with a view of the mountains is very large and heated (the temperature was in the fifties and sixties). There is also a large outdoor hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS A DEFINITE PLACE TO STAY.”
Reviews.Author: rixter26
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, beautiful grounds. Friendly staff. Awesome happy hour/snack buffet! Great pool and hot tub. Rooms were spacious and we got two rooms across from one another. Both had amazing views! This hotel is also within walking distance to several restaurants and Paradise Hills Mall as well as a Target. Will definitely stay here again if I'm in this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tracytj
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the view of the greens of the golf course right outside our balcony, and the mountains in the distance. Our daughter enjoyed the pool, although it was not that big, it was a nice place to cool off and relax. The free managers reception was outstanding and the whole family loved the made to order hot breakfast. The omelets were heavenly! Only downside was the additional charge for wireless internet, that should really be another amenity that is offered to guests free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton rips off their customers!”
Reviews.Author: stoumbaugh
Reviews.Content: If I'm going to throw down $150/night for a room, I expect the wireless internet to be free; not an additional $15/day. I'm an online student and need access to internet service everywhere I go. Not to mention there was a clear lack of management. Cleaning crews struggled with cleaning. We walked by a dinner platter located outside the door of a neighboring suite for 2 days, before we finally had to call and ask someone to come pick it up. Although the view is nice, this hotel is overpriced and not well managed, and the HILTON chain needs to wake up and realize they are ripping people off!! Even Motel 6 can offer free internet, or Starbucks for crying out loud and they're not charging hundreds of dollars to stay in a stinky, unkept mess of a hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so hotel with exhorbitant wifi charge”
Reviews.Author: Tim&Bill
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel the week of Oct. 7th while my partner attended a seminar and to visit family. The location is sort of out the way from most attractions in Phoenix, a reason the front desk used to justify the $15 per day charge for wi-fi. The rooms, while large, are rather dated and not in the best of shape. Our room (actually a 2 room suite had wallpaper that was loose and dirty carpeting. In fact, housekeeping did not vacuum the carpets for the first 3 days. While we had 2 flat panel TVs, the selection of stations was very limited. Some things to beware of if you choose to stay here: The $15 a day charge for wi-fi (the rooms at one time allowed hispeed connections, but that has been discontinued; no coffee is available in the lobby after breakfast (you can buy a cup for $3.50 at the bar; the bottle of water in the room costs $4.95 per bottle (not a big bottle either); and beware if your credit card is also a debit card. They put a hold on a significant portion that can take up to 3 weeks to get released; I found it interesting that when I commented on the wi-fi charge, the person at the front desk later tracked me down and gave me an article on hotels charging for wi-fi. The basic premise is that since people now use cell phones, hotels have lost a big source of revenue from the use of in-room phones so thay make it up with wi-fi charges. When I stated that many hotel chains and mom & pop motels provide it free, the person argued with me and said he had worked in a number of hotels and they all charge for wi-fi. I am amazed that companies and organizations continue to use Embassy Suites considering these inconveniences. I have run into these things at 3 different Embassy Suites in the last year. I would recommend choosing another hotel, there are many in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family trip”
Reviews.Author: ALJARN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy one night during a several night vacation. The hotel is on a golf course and we requested a room with a view of the golf course and mountains in the background-it was very nice. Our room had a balcony with chairs and table so you could enjoy the view. The rooms were large and comfortable. The outside sitting area had the usual Embassy furnishings-table/chair/sofa sleeper, kitchenette area with sink, fridge and microwave. Bathroom was two rooms-one with vanity, one with shower and commode. All rooms were clean and linens were fine. Pool area was large with large area for sitting/lounging. Evening reception was nice-soda, alcoholic beverages and snacks. Morning breakfast bar was wonderful with an omelet bar, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit.....very nice. Location is on the north side of Phoenix, easy to access from the Interstate. Overall, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel that is conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: hotpapa1219
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here when we attended a University of Phoenix Graduation about 30 minutes away. The room was very clean and pretty well maintained. Even though the day time temperatures were in the 110 F degree range, the room was always cool and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was very good, but don't wait until "closing time" as the crowd seem to arrive about 30 minutes prior to that. The pool was excellent and the hot tub, very hot. The evening reception did offer a nice selection of drinks, but the snacks consisted of only pretzels and goldfish crackers. Many dining choices are also close by.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Three Stars, No More, No Less”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob96
Reviews.Content: Good value if you can get <$100! Good breakfast, the suites are nice, but the snacks are poor, the internet is expensive, and the service is mediocre! The gym is very good so is the business center! The Embassy in NYC is much better, but I cannot compare!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: stevenandrophy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, but I was expecting more. The website makes it sound like a perfect place, but it is an average hotel, but the rooms are very nice and clean. Don't visit the 3rd floor, it is very smoky!

Reviews.Title: “Depends What You're Looking For”
Reviews.Author: Paul_in_VA
Reviews.Content: First, let's talk location. This Embassy Suites is smack on a private golf course in Paradise Village, an attractive, nicely landscaped, planned community of residences (private homes and condos) and mid-level shopping (Macy's, Target, etc.) and dining (Coco's, e.g.) on the Scottsdale _side_ of Phoenix. In real estate terms, it's "Scottsdale adjacent". It's not "Scottsdale" in the way people mean it when they say "Scottsdale" with stars in their eyes. That said: Clean and well run. Quiet. Rooms with golf course views have dead on views of Camelback Mountain in the near distance. Nice pool and hot tub. Free parking. Rooms and amenities, incl. full, hot, cooked-to-order breakfast are standard Embassy Suites. Hotel that appears to have been fully renovated within the last year or so. Know what you're getting, and you'll be quite happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good choice!”
Reviews.Author: KMLNY
Reviews.Content: Just had a very nice nine-day stay at the Embassy Suites Scottsdale over Easter break. Received a great rate ($109) from a discounted website and it was well worth the price. The breakfast served each morning is plentiful and fresh - especially at the counter where eggs/omlets are preapred to order. The breakfast alone saved this family of four more than $40 per day! Facilities are nice...pool area clean, towels supply refreshed. Location is good with conveniences located within 10 minutes walking/5 driving. Hotel is located about a 20 minute drive to ASU and 35 minutes from Chandler. Everything you need...clean rooms, helpful staff, good food, great price, beautiful scenery. Chances are you won't spend much time in the actual hotel room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Not our best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: SleepDeprivedCanada
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed the Phoenix/Scottsdale area for the first time and booked this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. It turned out to be pretty much what it appeared to be based on the posted pictures. It is in a good location - easy to access major roads and shopping is within walking distance. The hotel was nice. The room was nice and clean (one door handle was crusty & sticky), well decorated and comfortable. The views from the room overlooking the golf course and mountains in the distance was very beautiful. We had a couple of issues with noise resulting in loss of sleep. The first was that a large convention was in the hotel for the same weekend and the participants were mainly younger teens to young adults. They were everywhere in the hotel in full costume at all hours and were very loud. We heard them loudly laughing, talking and running thru the hallways at all hours of the days and night, Maybe the hotel could have booked non-conference guests into a separate floor(s) to separate us a bit. Also contributing to the lack of sleep was that the grounds crew starts to mow the greens on the golf course at about 4 am. The convention participants completely took over all the public areas of the hotel during the weekend and we noticed that the elevator (very smelly!) and hallways got a bit dirty. We too experienced the long delay in getting hot water that another review commented on. It seems like a large waste of water to have to run it for many, many minutes before getting water hot enough to shower in. The other complaint I have is one which is generalized to all hotels but this one is also guilty of. All the rooms we have stayed in over the past many years all have messages in them about how they are committed to environmental issues and ask guests to support them in their practices to reduce the use of water and detergent by reducing the volume of laundry. They ask guests to clearly show the housekeeping staff if they want new towels by either putting them on the floor or in the tub. This never happens. All towels are replaced every time they come in the room even if they are hung on hooks/towel bars or folded neatly on the counter (as was the case in this hotel as there were no hooks or towel bars in the sink area of the bathroom). We find this very irritating and frustrating. Lastly, our impression of the complimentary breakfast was that it fine. It was very busy during the weekend and the line for omelettes was long but the cooks were really amazingly organized and efficient. We enjoyed the fresh fruit, oatmeal and pancakes. The coffee was good. We tried to be there early rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice”
Reviews.Author: lindaraj1962
Reviews.Content: Chose this facility based upon the reviews on Tripadvisor. I normally prefer the service/amenities of a four or five star hotel but on this particular trip I knew we would basically just be sleeping here and not spending a great deal of time at the hotel. We ordered room service for dinner all three nights and not only was the service quick, but the food was actually very good! We were on the fourth floor and it took a good seven minutes before any hot water made it to the shower. I was quite concerned and thought I would have to move, but I learned to just turn on the shower and go brush my teeth and take my meds while the water was arriving! The only real negative was the free breakfast. Nasty! We only tried it once. The scrambled eggs were very cold and spongy. Literally. They had little tiny air bubble holes and felt like a sponge in your mouth. The potatoes were also cold. Although this part is not the fault of the hotel, it still annoys me. The people there for breakfast were rude! Good grief....why does "free" make people forget their manners? We had people step right in front of us, bump into us (and not say "excuse me"), reach over the plate in our hands, and.....my personal favorite.....touch food with their bare hands. Fine inexpensive choice for a hotel........just skip the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: JoScoPo
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 6 night stay at the Embassy Suites in Scottsdale so I figured I'd put in my two cents of where it ranks in my books. The GOOD: My father, brother and I booked a 2 bedroom suite with a view of the golf course. I called this hotel the day before our arrival and left a message for the hotel manager, Jessica, confirming ourselves into a good room and upon arrival she greeted us and had us reserved in room 6013 (possibly the best view of the golf course and on the top floor). The room was clean, spacious, updated and as previously mentioned had a spectacular view. The shower was spacious and never had a problem with not having the towels restocked. The cleaning ladies were friendly and efficient as well. There are a lot of stores and restaurants surrounding this hotel and within walking distance (Olive Garden, Subway, McDonalds, Outback Steakhouse and Target among others). The pool and hotub area were well maintained and set to a perfect temperature. We were also able to walk the golf course and enjoy the scenery as the fairways and greens were in pristine condition. Every morning they held a make-to-order omelet breakfast that lasted from 6:00am-9:30am which also held a wide range of breakfast items from muffins, bagels, toast, coffee, juices, sausage, bacon, hashbrowns, fruit, yogurt and pancakes. Each night the hotel had Managers Reception which allowed all guests of legal drinking age to enjoy complimentary drinks from 5:30pm-7:30pm. The BAD: When booking this hotel a big advantage this hotel had over others was the complimentary full breakfast it offered. Unfortunately the hotel staff did not seem ready for the amount of guests it had booked during the long weekend. The seating area was not able to hold the amount of guests booked at this hotel and had guests venturing out to the bar area and lobby in order to have breakfast. Ontop of this, it was rare to even see one bus-boy clearing tables leaving guests to set dirty trays wherever they could find. The line-up to get an omelet averaged around 15-25 minutes and getting to the other types of food in the chafing dishes was always a challenge as well. I have been to the Embassy Suites in San Diego and LA and both had bigger and better lobby areas as well. Don't get me wrong, a lobby does not make or break a hotel but I just remember being "wowed" in San Diego when walking into the main entrance and seeing fish swimming in the indoor pond and being able to walk over the bridge having the fish swim directly beneath you compared to walking into the E.S. in Scottsdale and seeing... a normal lobby. The Ugly: What I still am scratching my head over is the fact this hotel just underwent renovations to update the rooms and hallways yet decided against renovating the elevators. Such a small cost yet it was left untouched. They were the only thing in this whole hotel that looked dated. Again, an elevator doesn't make or break a hotel but if I were the owner, I'd reconsider that decision. All in all we enjoyed our visit to Phoenix and had a good time at the Embassy Suites. It was a nice place to come back to after a long day of doing tourist activities. I think if I visited this hotel when it was not a long weekend the breakfast service would not have been an issue. I would recommend for the owners of the hotel to invest some more money into some minor renovations to possibly turn this 3 star hotel into a 4 star. Overall I would rate this hotel as an 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Need Car”
Reviews.Author: Gavitar
Reviews.Content: Pros: 24 hr Business Center (free internet but only 2 terminals, printing). Free breakfast buffet. Nice staff. Fridge and sink in suites (suites same price as non-suites). Comfortable conference rooms and abundant food service. Rooms were comfortable/clean, not top of the line but doesn't require remodeling. Free onsite parking. Cons: All vending machines were out. No shuttle service from PHX, my ride cost $38 before tip (lots of surcharges and $2/mile from the airport). Hotel does provide shuttle bus to nearby places.
