Bus stop a few blocks away ($2.50 for all day pass). Mall, stores, CVS, restaurants nearby and walkable. This is a 3 star hotel - no valet services, or other services you expect of a "full service" hotel. Other: Hotel is frequented by soccer groups and other groups, so may be a good group venue. I didn't take advantage of the golf course/pool, but it looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: stjohnar
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is outstanding. Stayed at many Hilton properties, but this is by far one of the best. The suite was large, spotless, well maintained (suite 4028 overlooks the pool and the golf course). The "made to order" breakfast had excellent variety.. with the "made to order" being any style egg or omlet. Best time for breakfast was after 8:30 when business people vacated and went to the many function going on in the hotel. The manager's reception was okay with many business types taking up most of the room. The location mandates a car, and has easy access to major routes and loops around Phoenix. Pool was a nice temp ( visited in January from R.I. so anything was better then the snow in R.I. :)). All staff members were freendly and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MSPilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan. 5th '09 (The Fiesta Bowl game was going on.) Although there was lots of people and traffic around the hotel and area, it was still quiet and peaceful. I never heard anything in my room. I am impressed with the total privacy of this hotel yet it is convienent (easy walking distance 5 to 10 mins) to plenty of eating places from fastfood to sitdown. I like that Target and REI is real close by. Also a mall with Dept stores: Macys, ect is right there too. This hotel has a nice pool right in the back and a beautiful golf course. The driving range is right there! I cant wait to play it sometime. The rooms are always clean ( i stay here about 6 times a year) and well maintained. I stayed here one time and there was a wedding party happening. It was rather loud in the lobby area but the rooms were perfectly quiet. You are only about 15 drive fom Scottsdale airport and about 30 min drive from PHX in moderate traffic. The beds are very comfy! The covers for the beds are plush. The rooms are big. I'd say this one ranks a grade above the standard Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: filosab
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a golf course view room (which is a must,). The view from the room is just beautiful, the front desk staff are very friendly and professional. The rooms are extremely spacious, with a large fridge, two plasma screen TV's, plenty of room to spread out. The balcony is a nice size as well. The Manager's Reception is held outside Monday - Friday and is lovely. On the weekends, it's inside. Can't beat the free drinks and snacks. The breakfast is wonderful too. The location is great. Walking distance to just about any store and restaurant you can think of, as well as a mall, and a gym. Centrally located. This was our second stay at this hotel and we plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on business, and I was really impressed with the updated decor, great service, and incredibly comfy rooms. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was just right, and the buffet breakfast was good. If staying in this area, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: CudjoeKeylover
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay at this property. Having never stayed at an Embassy Suties before, I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Well, the property exceeded my expectations in virtually every category; in short, it helped make a rather mundane business trip a fun and memorable vacation. Every morning begins with a large, tasty, complimentary breakfast--restaurant quality; every evening includes a 2-hour happy hour by the pool which, after a long day, could not be more appreciated; the room itself was spacious, clean, modern, and welcoming, unlike so many other mid-level properties; the location was not on a major thoroughfare and thus was quiet and relaxing; lastly and most importantly, the staff is incredibly friendly and accomodating...they seem to enjoy working there and that goes a long ways towards making the stay a success. I would certainly stay here again and would recommend the same to anyone else who's tired of either worn down, malaised properites or overpriced hoity-toity places that simply don't live up to what the customer is paying. Thanks to all who made my stay so memorable, especially Lauren at Tatum's Bar and Eric at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanl612
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for one night in June. Very clean, great location, helpful staff, and gorgeous view. Nice running path along golf course in front of hotel and shopping mall across street. Great breakfast buffet. Very clean and well kept pool. Hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Ugly...”
Reviews.Author: trngdir76
Reviews.Content: The Good: I stayed at this hotel over a 2 week period in June '08. The first week was spent in a King Suite, and there was really no problems that could be mentioned other than the soaps and things were not restocked fully each day (no big deal!). The Bad: The second week was spent in a Double Double room. First thing to mention is the double beds are tiny. They may be okay for kids, or smaller people, but I found them very small, and certainly would not work for 2 people at all. This second stay was a complete joke! First thing that was wrong, was that the shower did not have hot water for the first 2 days of the stay. I had spoken to the manager on duty the first morning and maintenance was sent out, but the second morning the temperature of the water was the same... ICE COLD! I ended up speaking to the general manager, who was USELESS, she promised to to return my calls and never did. The assistant manager John finally resolved the problem. The Ugly: There was NO internet in the rooms ALL WEEK! I realize or some this may be no big issue, but being there on business with no access to email and the internet was crazy! I was shocked that they could not resolve this problem the entire week, and every time I would call they would say, "Still working on it!".... Shocking! I would not wish my second stay at this hotel on my worst enemy, it was painful from start to finish...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: quiet-pro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to booking in to our regular resort for the week.Paid an extra $10 to have an upper floor room with a view of the pool and adjoining Stonecreek golf course.This was well worth it as we had a very nice corner unit with excellent views.The Managers Reception in the evening was OK as long as you stayed with beer as the other drinks were all made using very low quality liquor.The snacks were an insult as they were of such low quality,in fact they should not even bother to put that stuff out. The breakfast that is also included in the price was much better and the guy who was making four different omelettes at the same time,with a smile on his face,was great!Give him a raise! I couldn't believe how close the golf course was;it came right up to the hotel.You were able to walk out from your room straight onto the practice range and start hitting balls.I was surprised at the apparent high quality of the condition at Stonecreek and next time I go I will set aside enough time to play the course. All in all for the price we obtained on the hotel website this was good value and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Scottsdale.”
Reviews.Author: Summer4
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay stay at the Embassy Suites in Scottsdale. Hotel was just great. Very comfortable beds, lots of room in suite, very clean and good pool area. If you are looking for a great value in pricey Scottsdale this is a great choice. The hotel is right on the golf course and was about a 10 - 15 minute drive to downtown Scottsdale ( where the fashion square mall and other shops & restaurants are). Next time we go to Scottsdale and are looking for a great value we would definitely stay here. And the cooked to order breakfast with other hot selections is great. And managers evening reception is fun too!

Reviews.Title: “Scottsdale Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MeAndMyGal
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place in Scottsdale with a view of the mountains. I saw the pictures of the hotel on skyauction and made a bid. We didn't know what to expect because we booked through an auction site but when we arrived we were very impressed with the hotel, the service, and the location. We asked for a mountain view room, it was confirmed by the hotel and that is what we got. (Thanks Ryan). The next day, after walking the path along the golf course, we thought a room on a different wing of the hotel would be even nicer. We requested a change and it was done without a problem. (Thanks Amanda). All the staff we encountered during our six day stay was friendly and accommodating. The full breakfasts were great, made to order eggs, way too much bacon and sausage, and the staff was friendly and eager to please. The manager's reception was much appreciated, especially after the days we golfed on the course (Stonecreek) which the hotel overlooks. Our room was spacious enough, we very much liked the suite layout and sitting on the balcony looking at the views. The location, for us, was perfect. It is on a golf course, surrounded by nice residential areas, close to shopping, restaurants and easy access to the highways to go to places like Sedona and Cave Creek. There is also a complimentary shuttle that will take you to, and pick you up from, places you would want to see around the hotel (Thanks Dave). We will definitely return to this hotel when we decide to visit the Scottsdale area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for golf, and a perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryKarr
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in March 2008 for a golf weekend, booked through a tour operator and prepaid. The room was perfectly sized for two middle-aged guys. The view was great. Only two issues -- one morning we awoke briefly to the shower running next door (walls must be really thin) and another morning the leaf blower was firing up at 6:30 a.m. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay. And service at the adjacent StoneCreek golf club was fabulous. We had no problems with the breakfast service, and we were amused with the server at the manager's reception who insisted on shouting "Tequila!" every time someone asked for a margarita.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Delivered”
Reviews.Author: AZGR8BNB
Reviews.Content: Our son was to be married and we were looking for a property that could accommodate us and our out-of-town family and friends comfortably and affordably. The rooms were spacious, the complimentary breakfast surpassed expectations, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the four nights at the Embassy turned out to be a very good experience. The feedback we received from those in our party of more than 25 was all positive. One of our four nights was spent in the Presidential Suite so that we could host a party for our group, and (except for a broken jacuzzi) all was well. We would recommend the hotel to others in similar situations. Thank you, Evelyn, for your assistance in the booking!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the value”
Reviews.Author: JKMMP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in early June, spending most of our time in Phoenix, along with a couple of days at the Grand Canyon and a day in the Tucson area. Phenomenal value for the money (we prepaid via the Internet several months in advance)--consistently pleasant service, beautiful setting, and a nice pool--the latter wasn't huge, but was very nice and bigger than I had expected from the hotel's web photos. The room, breakfast and daily manager's special were all up to Embassy standards. The only mildly sour note was the F.O.E. convention that took over (and I mean took over) the property our last several days there. Still, this was, dollar-for-dollar, probably the best hotel value I've experienced. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: funsandiego
Reviews.Content: A very nice and quiet location with shopping and restaurants close by. Our room was spacious and comfortable, although it was a bit dated. The beds were very comfortable. Tatum's Restaurant was excellent. Room service was slow and the food arrived cold. The complimentary breakfast was a bit of a hassle - long lines, warm orange juice and we had to wait quite a while for our omelets to be cooked. The following mornings we just grabbed some yogurt and fresh fruit. before heading out for the day. The staff is nice and very accommodating. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in nice area near Paradise Valley”
Reviews.Author: IUBBFAN
Reviews.Content: we stayed here recently for 3 days and really enjoyed it. We had a golf course view which also looked over the pool. The rooms were well kept and did not seem to have any issues with noise or dirtiness anywhere in the establishment. The breakfasts were a great addition in the mornings, it was great to read the paper outside and eat breakfast and look out over the course. The managers reception was pretty fun each night as well, free drinks and appetizers. I was there with my wife and we both agree that we really enjoyed our stay here and would surely return when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean & Safe!”
Reviews.Author: Cusita
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and my 4 yrs. old daughter from July 17-July 23, 2006. I chose this place because I read that it was a safe place. Since I was alone with my child most of the time (and the news of 2 serial killers in Phoenix), safety was a serious issue for us. I found the hotel nice and clean. We loved the breakfast partly cooked by order. The service at the restaurant was excellent although the food is not great. We ate at the restaurant several times and I can recommend the burgers, tortillas, quesadillas, hot dogs, chicken strips and wings, salads and fruits. ( Did not like the pizza.) Room service was good and very fast. We found the room big and fairly clean but the tub needed an upgrade. The main dissapointment was with the maids, they cleaned the room very late in the afternoon most of the days and they were kind of rude...we needed to request hand towels and toilet papers several times...Overall is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: txn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, July 1, 2006. We stayed on the fifth floor with a wonderful view of the swimming pool and the golf course. The made to order breakfast was very good. Since the hotel has "Scottsale" in it's name, I incorrectly assumed it would be closer to the main shopping areas of Scottsdale, but it was about 10 miles away. But, traffic wasn't bad so it wasn't a problem. We did have several problems with the room: the sliding glass door leading to the balcony would not lock, the mini-fridge didn't work at all, and the sink and the shower were very, very slow to drain. We would have asked for a different room if we had been staying longer. We had a rate of $99.75 with tax included. This was a good rate considering the size of the rooms, which included a bedroom with two beds and a t.v., a comfortable sofa bed in the living room, and a large dressing area separated by a door from the toilet and shower. Overall, I was disappointed with some of the problems with the room but would try the hotel again if I needed to stay in Phoenix and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Robscrob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first night of a 5-day trip to AZ. Hotel is located close to mall, restaurants. Beautiful landscaping, clean rooms. Had a great view from our 5th floor room, facing the golf course & pool. Lobby was under construction, but never heard a thing from our room. Great staff, extra friendly, great concierge. Had a nice manager's reception from 5:30-7:30pm, with complimentary cocktails and chips/salsa/cheese dip out by the pool. Pool area is great - complete with water misting the patio area, to help beat the heat. Price of room also included a cooked to order breakfast, down in the restaurant. Had a great fresh-cooked omelet and breakfast bar - would have cost us $30 or more if the three of us had gone out to the IHOP right down the street instead. Stayed in a double bed suite - bath/toilet was separate from sink/mirror - made getting ready in the morning much easier. Bedroom was separate from living room - felt like an apartment instead of a hotel, but without the noise of an apartment complex. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Phoenix/Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Liked It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night there on the way back from northern Arizona -- before making the long drive home. Could have stayed there a couple nights, and we don't even play golf. We had just returned from an awful hotel in the same chain in Flagstaff and were thrilled to be at a nice place again. Large and well-kept rooms. The pools are large and warm to the point of bath water. No complaints. Can't comment on the golf course, obviously. Lot's of chain store shopping and restaurants nearby. A real good family Mexican restaurant is close, called JG's or something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a good hotel. We stayed in room 4042 which had a private balcony overlooking the golf course. The room was clean and quiet. The hotel was located in a good area with plenty of shopping and restaurants close by. The breakfast in the morning was very good with omelets and eggs made to order, plus fresh fruits, and cereals.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for the most part.....”
Reviews.Author: SugarWahine
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over Christmas and got an amazing rate. I would say its above average for Scottsdale hotels unless you go the resort route and I don't count this place as a resort. The hotel was very nice... the staff very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was typical embassy suites fare, but for the rate we paid, a nice asset. Our room was fine, not dirty (and I am a dirt freak) in the least. The bed was rather soft and yes the sheets did not fit and the door does slam rather loudly, but none were dealbreakers for us. I should mention that the hotel was only about 50% full so perhaps that made things more tolerable in terms of the noise, breakfast, etc. Not sure what it would be like during spring training which is the busiest time of year. The only real bummer was trying to get my cell phone charger back that fell out of my bag in the room. Lost and found there was kind of lame... They had to charge me with a cc# for packing it up and shipping it even though I offered to give them a fedex # and ups #.... Charging for putting it in a fedex envelope? While in Scottsdale, be sure to try Don and Charlies. YUM! A great place for steak lovers and baseball fans.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Husband and I had a long stay of 12 days. We had to wait a little over a hour for room to be ready, so no early check in here. I had asked for a quiet room with a view. There was no gaurantee that we would have a room with a view unless we paid $20 more a night, so we choose to pay. I ended up with a room over the swimming pool which was all but quiet.The carpet was so stained and dirty that you did not want to walk around bare footed. The couch was stained especially on the arms. The dining room menu had very little selections but with high prices. I don't think there was much help in the kitchen. The bed was uncomfortable, not because of the mattress but because of the bedding that did not fit. Small gift shop for a hotel this size. We had made reservations to eat the Thanksgiving Buffet. There were not many names on the reservations when I made reservations for 3. Our table was the worse in the whole dining room, right in the isle so people had to pass our table. We asked for another table but was told the tables were already assigned even though there were other empty table with 3 place settings and chairs. The doors of the rooms closed loudly so each time someone near you left their room you would hear it. Unfortunately a family with 4 or 5 children ran up and down the hallways and in and out of their rooms slamming their doors each time. It would actually shake the wall. We complained to management but it didn't help and there was no follow up by management regarding the complaint. If it wasn't that it was holiday week, we would have tried to move to another hotel. The free full breakfasts and the free drinks at Manager's nights are some of the nice amenities. The personnel was very friendly and attentive. Overall I would not return, for what we ended up paying for 12 days and what we got we could have paid an extra $50 a night and got a 4 star hotel with cleaner, more comfortable room and it would have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent Style and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: scott104
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare at Day’s Inn my wife and I decided to stay at Embassy Suites. All rooms come with a separate bedroom. Our early check in was greeted with a warm and friendly smile. They had plenty of rooms (off season) and we had no problems getting a room well before the check in time of 3PM. Our room was extremely clean. Our balcony on the 6th floor overlooking the golf course and the majestic mountains in the distance only fit two people. You can enter in the bathroom from the bedroom or the living room. The kitchenette provided us with a coffee maker, refrigerator, and a microwave. The bedroom closet included a room safe and ironing board. All the essentials you need while traveling. The high speed internet provider is waypoint. With a $10.00 a day fee you can retrieve your emails. The desk was situated between the kitchenette and the living room and included a nice leather swivel chair. I had to say, this arrangement was quite stylish. They had complimentary cocktails at happy hour between 5pm and 7pm which we could not enjoy. We did, however, enjoy the complimentary breakfast. The friendly staff had eggs, home fries, pancakes, omelets, and plenty of coffee to start your day. It was absolutely delicious. If you take into account how much you would pay for breakfast and happy hour, take off the $129.00 per night stay and you will realize that the rooms are really not that expensive. The other reviews here stated that the elevators were slow. In agreement that you do have to wait 30 seconds to 1 minute longer than average, I cannot possibly count this as a negative towards my review. If you are on vacation or on business, and you come from the east coast as I do, the slower pace in the southwest is refreshing change from high stress of the east. This slower life style is integrated in every aspect of Phoenix, Arizona. So relax or take the stairs. Every detail was taken care of at our stay at Embassy Suites. Located near the mall in Scottsdale, and just 10 minutes from highway 51, I don’t think that you can stay at a finer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: eslkerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites after staying at the one near the Biltmore last year for our yearly Girl's Weekend Out!. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were in Room 5012 at the end of one wing, overlooking the pool and golf course and driving range. The extra few dollars we paid for a guaranteed view room was worth it. We sat on the balcony after dark when it cooled down and enjoyed the lights too. The view was great and we did not hear any of the dreaded tee time calls. Without repeating what others have said, we did take advantage of free drinks by the pool from 5:30-7:30 with some snacks available. In contrast to others, we were glad that drinks were in plastic glasses as we were by the pool. We noticed that some folks were ordering snacks from the restaurant at the same time. We also enjoyed the breakfast (also free) and never had a hard time finding a seat or waiting too long in line for omelettes. The pool is indeed a little small for the size of the hotel, but surprisingly, the pool itself wasn't terribly overcrowded on the Fri, Sat and Sunday that we were there and I understand they were close to being full this weekend. It was a little hard to find lounge chairs, but mostly because we wanted one in the shade and two in the sun. Picky picky. The two beds were double and seemed short - not a problem for me, but someone tall might have a tough time. I didn't think they were overly hard either - slept well. We ordered room service on Friday night after more drinks than were advisable to drive for dinner and the food was fairly good, plentiful and no more expensive than usual. It is close to shopping - Paradise Valley mall is an older mall, but we certainly didn't have trouble spending money. There are also many other stores nearby. We had little interaction with the desk area after check in which was easy and the clerk was courteous. Towels were quickly supplied as was room service.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Phoenix-Scottsdale
HotelInfo.Address: 4415 East Paradise Village Parkway South, Phoenix, AZ 85032
